University of Minnesota
General Extension Division
Minneapolis 14
Radio Station KUOM
November 23, 195U
Mr. Frank E. Schooley
Station WILL
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Frank:
Upon my return to the office yesterday after a week at the Land Grant
College meeting in Washington, I found your several reports dated
November 17. I hasten to answer.
First off, I am voting «yesw on both matters relative to the treasurer.
I have one slight question however; shouldn*t the bank account be set
up so that some other officer could sign a check in the absence or in¬
capacity of the treasurer? I recall we did this several years ago when
the late W. I. Griffith was treasurer, and it would seem a reasonable
safeguard. After all, we live in a dangerous age, what with motor cars,
airplanes and what have you, and it might be good to have the president or
someone authorized to sign checks against these funds if necessary. This
may be something which is already taken care of, but I mention it for what¬
ever it is worth.
Relative to the inquiry on committees, I fear I am the one director who
didn*t respond (see paragraph 2 of your report number 3), but this was
because I had previously written you about this, and not because I didn*t
give the matter a thought. Actually I approved your suggestions, for which
reason I didn*t comment on them further.
I shall bring myself up to date on the subscription television problem in
the next few days and offer a comment as to whether or not I believe NAEB
should take a position on it.
It is good to see that you are getting in to matters so well. I hope to
be of every assistance possible.
With best personal regards.
Burton Paulu
Manager of KUOM
